page.title: 15Economics
page.content: To find out about the economics of the area we planned some questions,and interviewed Mr.Prosser the manager of LLoyds Bank Pengam and Mr.Jenkins the manager of the Halifax Building Society Fleur-de-lys.When asked what he thought the role of his bank was in Pengam in 1985,Mr.Prosser felt that it was to support the community and industry,and to provide a service.Part of the service was to provide facilities to let people save and borrow and to pass money from one to another.He felt that the bank had become more efficient with the new computerized banking systems.Monday and Friday were the busiest days with about 200 customers,on average daily, dealing with Â£11000 to Â£12000 a day. Mr.Prosser was glad that there was no cash point at Pengam,as he felt it would loose some of the personal touch
